scenes.location: A HOUSE IN THE HOLLYWOOD HILLS
characters: CREDITS BEGIN AS IN A SERIES OF CROSSCUTS
IN A SERIES OF SHOTS TO MUSIC
DOWN OFF THE EDGE OF THE FIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The view of downtown Los Angeles from the enormous, ornat is extraordinary.  A small outdoor dinner party is in pro A MAGICIAN is entertaining guests.  Playing cards and coi appear and disappear in his nimble hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDWARD HARRIS stands at the window, impassively looking d at the party.  Edward is a handsome, well groomed man of forty.  He looks tired; the kind of fatigue that can't be by a night's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (a murmur) Left pocket. And indeed, down below, the magician pulls the coin from left pocket of the incredulous WOMAN's silk blazer.  More laughter and applause. The study is in keeping with the rest of the house.  Luxu Everything the best.  WILLIAM STUCKEY, Edward's contempor is a crafty looking lawyer who is the party host.  VANCE investment banker.  His assistant JAKE, is a financial researcher.  The other men are INVESTMENT BANKERS.  They in dark suits and power ties.  On the table are stacks of documents and folders, the name "KROSS INDUSTRIES" is pro on many of the folders.

dialogues.speaker: INVESTMENT BANKER 1
dialogues.text: Our banks certainly doesn't want to discourage Harris Enterprises from investing in California. We think this is a great new venue for you but you've got to understand the mergers and acquisitions market is changing. With the upswing in inflation we have to make these offerings tempting to offset the risk.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Look, we're talking about hard assets and a straight liquidation. We have over a thousand man hours in this deal.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (losing patience) This is a "no brainer".  There's no risk for you.  No one has ever lost money backing Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: INVESTMENT BANKER 2
dialogues.text: Not yet.  But ship building is a new endeavor for you...

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Come on.  You know we're not going to go into ship building. Besides, you're the ones with the troubled track record, not us!

dialogues.speaker: INVESTMENT BANKER 3
dialogues.text: Bill, be reasonable.  If you're really going to digest Kross Industries that quickly eighteen should not be such a problem. Besides, I don't think there's anywhere else you can go for the money in the time you have.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's unacceptable. Edward turns from the window.  He hasn't miss a thing.  A eyes are on him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Draymen Heux has offered me seventy-five in the pool at sixteen and a half.  I can secure the other half personally.  You have until tomorrow morning to make me a better offer. The bankers speechlessly stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The meeting is over, gentlemen. He turns away.  The bankers look at one another.  They ri Silence as they exit.  When the door closes.  Stuckey exp with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Hah!  Did you see the look on their faces?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You don't think we pushed too hard?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: NO way!  They'll come back.  They can't afford not to.  Edward, that bluff was beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Maybe I should have made it rhyme. The others stare at him, uncertain.  Stuckey laughs.  The others follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) Well!  It's late.  We've been at this long enough. Stuckey rises.  Edward ushers Vance and Jake toward the d

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, enjoy the party.  The magician's wonderful. Vance and Jake exit.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (calling after them) Watch your left pocket. A BUTLER has entered the room.

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: Phone call, Mr. Harris.  It's Miss Charles.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Cynthia?  Is she coming out?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We're about to find out.  Go on. Take care of your guests. Stuckey exits the room as Edward crosses to the telephone

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (into phone) Where are you, Cynthia? (beat) I see. (pausing, getting angry) No, I don't expect you to be at my beck-and-call.  Are you coming or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward descends the long, curved stairway.  He has Vance tow.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (all business) Prepare the filing papers.  Have them ready by the middle of the week.  I'll tell you when to submit them. The PEOPLE talking and drinking on the stairway gravitate toward Edward.

dialogues.speaker: A MAN
dialogues.text: Edward!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (turning on the charm) Yes!

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: Will we see you at the polo matches Wednesday?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Wouldn't miss it. (abruptly; to Vance) I want this done fast and easy. No slip-ups.  I want to be back in New York by Saturday.  Got it? He deftly keeps making his way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuckey is sipping champagne and talking to a beautiful WOMAN in a tight sheath of an evening dress.  An elegant ELIZABETH STUCKEY approaches from behind him.  She taps h the shoulder and he turns, startled.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Bill?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (flustered) Oh... Hi, honey... Millicent, uh, uh, Millicent.

dialogues.speaker: MILLICENT
dialogues.text: Lowell.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Lowell, right.  My wife, Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: (ignoring her) Is Edward leaving? Stuckey looks up to see Edward moving quickly toward the Stuckey abruptly leaves the two woman together to follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward comes out of the house.  Jags, a limo with waiting DRIVER and two BMW's pack the circular driveway behind a Ferrari.  The limo driver leaps to attention at the sight Edward.  Edward stands, making an obvious effort to keep impatience under control.  Stuckey comes out of the house down the walk.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: What's up, where you going?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Give me your car keys, will you, I'm going back to my hotel.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: At least stay for a drink.  This party's for you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Apologize to Elizabeth for me. Stuckey gropes uncertainly in his pocket for keys.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Listen, there're some major local talent inside just dying to meet you...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (as if delighted) Really?  Some high class gold digger who speaks French better than I do? (turning away) No, thank you.  I just got off the phone with one.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Cynthia's not coming?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No. Edward grabs the keys out of Stuckey's hand.  He crosses black Ferrari and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Let your driver take you.  We'll move the cars... Edward starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Can you drive a stick? The car lurches forward with a squeal of wheels and promp stalls.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Edward, give me a break! With a squeal of tires, the Ferrari bucks out of the driv and... stalls again.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Love this car!  Is it new?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Yes!  And you don't even know where you're going! Edward starts it again and heads uncertainly uphill.  Stu watching, throws up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: That's the wrong way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari, moving fast through the Hollywood Hills, pas large, beautiful homes... Edward shifts, grinding gears..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari comes to a red light and pulls up next to a D The GIRL in the Colt looks at Edward and his car admiring Edward feeling confident now, revs the engine.  The light green.  Edward immediately stalls the Ferrari.  The Colt him in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward drives.  He blinks, shakes his head as if trying t himself of his own tired thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari comes to the intersection of OUTPOST and FRAN stops.  Edward gets out of the car.  He looks at the stre signs.  He has no idea where he is.  He signs.  He gets b in the car and takes off on Franklin heading East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crumbling old apartment building.  Dark alley ways, des parking lot. The Ferrari -- blink and you miss it -- motors past the b looking very out of place on the street. PANNING UP  A building facade of lit windows and metal fi escape.  One window in particular.  A GIRL stands there i short kimono, looking down.  And then she turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS to see her dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIVIAN turns and stares at herself in a grainy, cracked b mirror.  She is twenty years old and a prostitute.  Make- applied to give her a hard, older look doesn't quite succ She'd be innocently beautiful without it.  She is wearing shorts, a tight tube top, thigh high boots.  She stares a herself, not really liking what she sees.  A moment.  She turns off the light and walks out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faded, peeling walls.  Thread bare, dirty carpet.  Vivian the apartment door behind her and starts down the dim hal A door suddenly opens, startling her.  An unshaved, enorm pot bellied MAN in a stained t-shirt stares at Vivian wit eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: Vivian. Vivian turns some "tough" on him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, what?

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: Rent.  You're late.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Don't give me that.  Kit gave it to you yesterday, cash.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: Kit give me nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (suddenly uncertain) You bullshittin' me?

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: Of rent I do not bullshit. Vivian hurries at a run back down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: By the end of the week or you're otta here. (a beat) By the way, you look very nice tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian pulls a coffee can off a shelf.  She pulls off the It's empty.  She tosses the can away, starts for the door opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the hallway, the landlord is standing in front of hi doorway, talking to a FAT WOMAN.  They both glance up. Vivian quickly closes the door.  She doesn't want to deal them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes off the fire escape onto the sidewalk.  She away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian walks along, urgently looking for something... som A BABBLING STREET-TYPE goes by happily talking to himself He wears an "I Love Hollywood" t-shirt. Vivian passes TOURISTS but doesn't notice them any more t she pays attention to the VAGRANT she passes further on, in a doorway. A LONG-HAIRED KID on a SKATEBOARD goes by dropping off li bags to various STREET-TYPES. A BARKER-TYPE stands in front of a photo store urging tou to come in and take a photo with a cardboard cut-out of a star.  Some go in. Vivian hurries past a group of rubbernecking JAPANESE TOU A BLACK PROSTITUTE in a mini skirt strolls toward her.  A passes.  The DRIVER stares at Vivian with interest.  She him.  The black prostitute approaches the car.

dialogues.speaker: PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, you lookin' for a date? The Driver looks her over.  The Black Prostitute gets in car and it drives away. A GROUP OF MEN, mostly drug dealers, hang out at an all n coffee shop.  They WHISTLE and make obscene gestures and as Vivian hurries by.  She ignores them and goes next doo a falafel stand.  Half a dozen PEOPLE sit at dirty tables

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the counter are a MAN and a WOMAN, Vietnamese cook frying food, trying to ignore the unsavory crowd camped i shop.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Chan, you seen Kit tonight?

dialogues.speaker: COOK 1
dialogues.text: Hi, hi!  No see nothing.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You do, tell her I'm looking for her.

dialogues.speaker: COOK 2
dialogues.text: Looking good, bay-bee.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too, D'Nai.  If Kit comes in here, tell her stay. Both of them nod and smile at Vivian.  Vivian exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skateboard zips by a GROUP.  We SEE a police car parked a entrance to an alcove.  Also, an ambulance.  The bubblegu lights are going.  A CROWD has gathered.  The happy man w the "I Love Hollywood" t-shirt and a POLICE OFFICER are e in tense conversation.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: They just pulled her out of a dumpster in the back.  Now talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I tell you, man, I don't know who she hang with.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: She have a pimp?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Cocaine her pimp, man.  She a strawberry.  She be out on these streets, day in, day out, tradin' her sorry ass for crack.  And now she dead from it. Vivian rushes up to join the outskirts of the crowd as th of a YOUNG GIRL is pulled out of an open dumpster and car towards the waiting ambulance.  For a moment Vivian think it's... no, Vivian turns grimly away. Vivian surveys the dark street.  And suddenly sees who's looking for.  Walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE a young, tough-looking MAN and WOMAN trying on wig The STOREKEEPER is a man wearing a dress and wild wig.  T girl, KIT, is around 18, is dark haired and thin.  The yo man, CARLOS, has his arm sloppily draped across Kit's sho They giggle about something, both obviously high.  Kit lo up, bleary-eyed.  She stops.  Vivian is standing in front her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You spent it on drugs, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi, Viv.  Carlos, you know my roommate, Viv.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: Lookin' good, baby.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Did you blow it all, Kit?  Is it all gone?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Carlos had some great rock.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I bet. (beat) That was our rent! Carlos attempts to put an arm around Vivian's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: Calm down, Chica. Vivian throws him off.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: Ey!  What is it you wan', baby? I can fix you up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Beat it, scum bucket!

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: You kiss your mother with that mouth?  Your frien' still owes me 200.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (to Kit) Let's go. Skateboard appears suddenly, blocking Vivian and Kit's pa

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Get out of my face or I'll have those cops on your ass in two seconds. Carlos glares at her.  He looks down toward the lights of cop cars.  One of the POLICEMEN looks towards them, curio Vivian waves at the cop.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: (threatening to Vivian) Don't take no dates tonight, chica, you got one with me. Vivian grabs Kit by the arm and pulls her across the Boul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Kit sit at a table sipping tea.  Vivian is sti mad at her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: We worked for that money.  We were gonna put together enough to get out of that dump we live in, get off this street.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Viv... don't be stupid.  We're whores. Vivian looks like she wants to weep.  Or scream.  She doe neither.  She slowly nods.  Kit's sorry she said that. KIT (cont'd) So I blew our stash.  We could make it all back with one good night on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I just saw somebody pulled out of a dumpster.  I wonder how much she made tonight?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Don't be mad at me.  I'll pay you back.  I promise.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I thought you were giving up that drug shit.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I will.  I'm trying. (a beat) Meanwhile I got some crack left, you wanna get high?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, let's go to work.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Okay. (then touches her hand) I'm sorry I said your dream was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward's Ferrari turns onto Hollywood Blvd., finally out the Hollywood Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Kit are out trying to hustle John's in passing Vivian strikes a sexy pose at the bus stop.  Kit is talki another prostitute, RACHEL.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: No no, honey.  You see these stars on the sidewalk.  Me and Vivian work from Don Ameche all the way up to Roy Rogers. This is our office.  We got seniority.  Get off our corner.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I was just taking a rest here. Besides, she's new. (points to Vivian)

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: But I'm old.  Go rest up by Monty Hall or Debra Paget where you belong. Rachel walks off.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (looks at passing cars) Looks slow tonight.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Maybe we should get a pimp. Carlos likes you and --

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Forget it.  We work for it.  We keep it. They keep hustling.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I can't handle this tonight. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (stares at her) That crack is burning a hole in your pocket.  There isn't even milk in the fridge.  The rent's due.  Now come on --

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Hey, hey -- There's a rent.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: He's not gonna want us. The Ferrari goes by and stops.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (calls out to Vivian) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (excited) Don't take less than a hundred. You look hot tonight.  And remember, don't mouth off.  They don't like that.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Okay.  Go home.  But take it easy on that shit. Kit gives Vivian a quick hug.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You're the greatest.  I'll wait up for you. And then Kit is off, moving quickly away.  Vivian turns. stares at the Ferrari, loathing it and all it represents. then it's as if Vivian turns a switch.  She fluffs her ma hair, throws her shoulders back, thrusting her breasts ou sashays towards the car, a sexy, friendly smile on her fa In the driver's seat of the Ferrari, Edward is looking fu and distracted.  Vivian leans over the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hey Sugar, you lookin' for a date?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You looking' for some company?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Uh, no.  How do I get to Beverly Hills?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What? (dropping the come on) You gonna tell me you're lost?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Great.  What do I look like a tourguide? Edward takes a good look at her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (a beat) No, you look like a hooker.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm a movie star out for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good.  Can you tell me how to get to Beverly Hills?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Sure.  For five bucks.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: The price just went up to ten.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why don't you just do it out of the kindness of your heart?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Sit... and spin.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sit-and-spin. (amused) Alright... why not? He pulls out his money clip. Vivian suddenly freezes.  On the sidewalk up ahead, Carlo Skateboard.  Carlos flashes an evil, menacing grin.  He m to Skateboard, they start forward.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (holding up a bill) You have change for a twenty. Vivian pulls open the door of the car and jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: For twenty, Ill show you personal.  Drive. Edward stares at her.  She smiles sweetly. VIVIAN (cont'd) Make a "U-ee".  Beverly Hills is the other way. The Ferrari pulls away, passing Carlos on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Nice car.  Yours?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (as he grinds the gears; wincing) No.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Stolen?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Not exactly. He smiles.  Vivian smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Mind if I turn on some heat?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: If you can figure it out, be my guest. Vivian reaches out, turns on the heat.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Very good.  You're obviously mechanical.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (laughs) You're not from L.A., huh?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: New York.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What motel you staying at?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Okay, what hotel?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Regent Beverly Wilshire.  I bet you know it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (annoyed at his tone) Yeah, I peed in the fountain there once.  Give me a break. Edward glances over, amused.  It hits him that she really an attractive girl.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What do you want it to be? (a beat) Vivian, my name's Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You like being a hooker, Vivian?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It pays.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: So do day jobs.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Day jobs, yeah.  I've tried them. (a beat) Turn right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari glides along a seedy, West Hollywood section Santa Monica.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Must be dangerous.  Hooking.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.  L.A. is suffering from a wacko epidemic. And who knows where half the guys I pick up have been.  I mean, I use condoms.  Always.  And I get checked out once a month at the free clinic.  Not only am I better in the sack than an amateur, I'm probably safer.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Very good.  You ought to have that printed up on your business card.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (a moment) If you're making fun of me, I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sorry.  If I did, I didn't mean to. Vivian unconsciously bites her fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Ugly habit, biting your nails.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You don't know habits, you think this is ugly. But she puts her hands in her lap.  She looks out the win She's safe from Carlos.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Okay, pull over.  Let me out. I've got to get back to work. Edward pulls the Ferrari to the curb and stops. VIVIAN (cont'd) Stay on this street and you'll hit Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What do you charge for company, Vivian?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Company would cost you... a hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: For the whole night?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: For an hour.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're joking.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I never joke about money.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Neither do I. (a moment; amused) A hundred bucks an hour though. That's pretty stiff. She reaches across the seat.  Her hand goes in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, but it's getting there.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, how much to put up with me for the entire night?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You couldn't afford it. Vivian starts to get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Try me. A moment.  Vivian's sexy smile comes on.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three hundred.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What's your name, lover.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Edward.  My name is Edward.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Edward... you got it! Edward gets out of the car.  Vivian looks at him confused

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Get in.  This side.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You know how to drive a stick? Vivian moves around the car.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Better believe it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Then let's go.  It's worth 300 just so I don't have to drive. They get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts the car, revs it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Here we go Edward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari peels out, fishtails madly and SCREAMS up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of tiny white lights sparkle along the walls of Regent Beverly Wilshire Hotel.  Bright flags are illumina by carefully placed spotlights.  The Ferrari SCREAMS into driveway and comes to a jarring stop by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward takes a moment to get his breath.  He gestures tow the back.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My raincoat's in the back.  Put it on.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You may feel more comfortable. This is not the kind of place that rents rooms by the hour.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You mean they don't have hookers.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Every place has hookers, but if this hotel has hookers, they don't look like they're...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Off the boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk in, Vivian is tying the trenchcoat.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Great.  Now I took like a hooker in a trenchcoat. She looks up.  She stops in her tracks.  The lobby is bri and spacious, filled with thick carved wood paneling.  Ev this hour there is a great deal of activity.  MEN in busi suits and WOMEN in furs and jewels are passing by.  Vivia face quickly conceals the sudden awe she feels at the sig all this luxury.  Vivian matter of factly reaches out and Edward's arm.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: So let's go. Edward guides them across the lobby.  They reach the elev and go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young ELEVATOR OPERATOR is dressed in a clean red uni that seems just a bit too tight.  As the elevator doors c he nods toward Edward.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Evening, sir.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good evening.  Penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Penthouse.  My, my. She sees the operator glancing at her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: The penthouse.  And step on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian come out of the elevator into a hallway leading to a single doorway with two heavy wood doors.  E pulls out his key and unlocks the doors.  With a gentle p the door slide open in unison.  Edward gestures to Vivian go inside.  She does.  Edward closes the doors behind her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vivian steps into the room she has the sensation of fa off the top of the building.  In front of her is a sunken room with massive windows revealing the sparkling lights city below.  For the first time, she is speechless.  Edwa closes the door and walks past her down the steps to the room.  Edward picks up a phone.  Vivian checks out the ro

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Room service. (to Vivian) What do you drink?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Diet coke.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Send up a bottle of Crystal champagne.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Can I have some chips?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (into the phone) -- and a bowl of strawberries. Thank you. Vivian makes her way down the steps to the living room. stares at the view.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Vivian) Impressed? Vivian is impressed but she's not going to admit it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You kidding?  I come here all the time.  As a matter of fact they do rent this room by the hour. Edward smiles.  He sits down in a comfortable chair and l back.  Vivian looks at him. VIVIAN (cont'd) Well, now that you have me for the night, what are you going to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Want to know something?  I don't quite know.  I hadn't planned this.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Do you plan everything?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (a small smile) Always.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well, the meter's running, it's your money.  Speaking of which, cash'll do.  In advance.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Fair enough. He rises.  Takes out his wallet.  Standing over her, he d THREE crisp, new hundred dollar bills in Vivian's lap.  S picks up the bills, stares at them, trying not to be impr She puts the money in her jacket.  She realizes Edward is standing over her as if waiting. She leans forward, reaches out to unzip his pants.  He ab turns away.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let's talk some more first.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Right. (brightly) So!  In town on business?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (taking off his jacket) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Let me guess, you're a... lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (loosening his tie) And why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (a small smile) I dunno... you have that sharp, useless look. Edward almost smiles.  He sits across from her again.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Sounds like you've known a lot of lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've known a lot of everybody. A chime goes off to indicate there's someone at the door.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Champagne. He starts to sit up.  Vivian motions for him to stay put.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hey.  I might as well make myself useful. Edward sits back down.  Vivian waltzes up the steps and o the front door.  A WAITER comes into the room with a silv cart; on it is a bucket of champagne and a covered bowl.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Where would you like it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where would we like it?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Where would we like it?  Here'll be fine. The Waiter carries it down the steps and sets it in the m of the living room.  He turns and heads back up the stair pauses near Vivian, staring.  Vivian stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What are you looking at? The Waiter glances away uncomfortably and exits.  Vivian the door behind him.  Vivian marches back down the stairs

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think he wanted you to tip him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Tsk.  Excuse me, I didn't think he had change for a hundred. Edward crosses to the silver stand.  Vivian watches with interest as he twirls the champagne bottle in the ice buc VIVIAN (cont'd) You have a wife?  Girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I have both. Edward lifts the bottle out.  He deftly pops the cork on bottle without losing a drop of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where are they?  Shopping together?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: They should be.  They're both good at it. Edward pours the champagne into a single long stemmed gla hands one to Vivian. EDWARD (cont'd) My ex-wife lives in London in what used to be my home. My girlfriend is in New York moving out of my apartment even as we speak.  Cheers. He drinks, nods approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's a very good year.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oooh, thank god. Edward laughs softly.  She sips it.  To her surprise, rea likes it.  Edward lifts a lid on a silver bowl to reveal enormous strawberries.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Try a strawberry.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Because they bring out the flavor of the champagne.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Jesus, you act like you're seducing some Valley girl you picked up in a dance club.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian... the meter's running... cooperate. A moment.  She slowly eats a strawberry.  The juice of it her lips.  Her eyes are like smoke as she takes a sensuou of champagne, licks away the stain of the strawberry.  Hi haven't left her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (softly) You really are a very beautiful girl.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (husky-voiced) Just a romantic, that's you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes... Her mouth is so wet and inviting... he leans closer...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Me too. He's about to kiss her... VIVIAN (cont'd) Not on the lips. He freezes.  She pulls his head down to her breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian on the bed.  He is on his back, his sho and head resting against the headboard.  She is astride h hands resting on his chest, rocking... in control, confid very much liking the fire she's kindled in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (touching her breasts) What do you like?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: If I want you to turn me on I'll pay you three hundred.  Just lay back and let me drive. Smiling, Vivian reaches behind her, touching him.  He tri to groan.  She's moving faster now.  Edward suddenly pull violently to him, he rolls her over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy spray of water comes down upon Edward.  He stands quietly letting it wash over him.  He turns off the showe steps out of the stall, picks up a towel and dries himsel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward stares.  His expensive clothes are on the floor, haphazardly dropped everywhere.  Vivian's clothes, as tat as they are, are neatly folded and piled on a chair.  The incongruity of it touches Edward in a sad way.  He looks the bed.  Vivian is fast asleep.  Her heavy makeup has lo been rubbed off.  Asleep, her wary, smart-ass attitude is She looks like a sweet, gentle girl.  He stares at her a longer.  He turns, goes into the living room.  Vivian ope eyes.  Through the open door she sees Edward sitting in a room chair.  He is reading contracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is coming up as HOTEL EMPLOYEE hoses down the sid in front of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN EMPLOYEE is vacuuming the lobby.  She sees someth and pauses.  She pulls a dead leaf from one of the potted plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and A WAITER rolls a cart out int hallway.  He takes it to the doors of the penthouse.  He the bell.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter wheels in a table of food, coffee, champagne a orange juice.  Edward dressed in suit pants, white shirt suspenders, stands in the living room talking into a cord phone.  Edward points the Waiter to the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Sorry.  Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William Stuckey is behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Kross knows we're after his company.  He wants to talk with you.  I don't think you should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter returns.  Edward signs the bill.  The Waiter e

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I want to.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Edward, if the three of us sit down together we might as well announce our plans in the Wall Street Journal.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll see him alone.  Everyone knows you're my muscle.  We'll make it social.  Tell Kross I'll meet him for dinner.  Tonight if you can arrange it.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: You shouldn't go alone.  He might claim that you tried to black mail him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Bill, we're businessmen, not the damn mafia.  I'll see you in the office.  By the way, about your car...

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Oh, god, what?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (smiling) I'll bring it back. Edward hangs up.  He pours a glass of orange juice and ta a sip, thinking.  Something makes him turn.  Vivian, wear a monogrammed hotel terry robe, is standing uncertainly i bedroom doorway.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You didn't wake me.  I'll be out of here in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No hurry.  Would you like some breakfast? She's hungry and the breakfast looks great.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Only if you do. Edward sits.  Waits.  Vivian sits across from him.  Edwar serves them breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Did you sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Too good.  I forgot where I was.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Occupational hazard? She looks at him sharply, sees that he means no offense, relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where'd you go?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I took the couch.  I had some work to do. (hesitating) About last night...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oooh, Baby, you were the best. I was beside myself.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Mmm, I could tell.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I just hope it was worth three hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'd say you give a good dollar value. They share a small smile.  They eat.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do you ever... enjoy it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I like guys if that's what you're asking.  Not that I trust'm.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No?  Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: "Occupational hazard". A moment.  Edward chuckles.  Vivian grins. VIVIAN (cont'd) what do you do anyway?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I buy companies.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No shit.  They expensive? He almost smiles.  She almost smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The one I'm buying this week will cost around 150 million.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: ... dollars? He nods.  This time Vivian is impressed. VIVIAN (cont'd) You are major league, baby.  Your mother must be very proud. Edward is oddly pleased at her reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet door is open.  Edward reaches for a tie.  In t closet are about a dozen expensive looking suits, shirts, etc.  She follows him in.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: So what a ya do with the companies once you buy'm?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (fumbling with the tie) I sell them.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What?  Why? She undoes his knot and starts over. VIVIAN (cont'd) At ease, let me do that.  Part of the all night services.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: By breaking up a company's assets

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What are assets?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian --

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: C'mon, I might buy a company some day.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Assets are anything of value a company owns.  Sometimes the pieces are worth more than the whole.  By selling them off, I make a profit.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Sorta like stealing cars and selling'm for parts, huh?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Not... quite.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: There, see?  Now the emblem is right in the middle of the knot.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn to do this?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) I fucked the debate team in high school.  Tsk.  I had a grampa. He liked ties on Sundays.  You mind if I take a swim in your bathtub before I hit it?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don't drown. Vivian turns and heads toward the bathroom.  He follows h into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian turns on the water in the tub.  It fills the tub i torrential rush.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You could hold a pep rally in here! The phone on the marbled bathroom wall suddenly rings.  E reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuckey is walking around his desk.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Edward, it's me.  Kross is all set for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian stares curiously at the bidet.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Listen, I gotta say this again, I don't like you going alone. She turns it on.  The water hits her in the face.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (stifling a chuckle) I'm a big boy. There are lotions and shampoos and bubblebaths on the edg the tub.  Vivian regards them like a kid in a candy shop.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Let me at least get you a date. Keep it social. Edward watches as Vivian smells some bubble bath.  She sm Her eyes ask Edward if it's okay to...?  He nods.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Edward, did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: I know a lot of nice girls. Vivian pours the bubblebath into the swirling water.  The something about the look on her face... the way she bites lower lip... curious, sensual...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I have one. Edward hangs up the phone as Vivian curiously turns on th television.  The sound blares.  She fumbles to turn it do Edward reaches over and turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: All right.  How much for the week?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm in town until Saturday. She look at him like he isn't speaking English.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do-you-want-to-stay-here- for-the-week? It takes Vivian a moment to respond.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It'd cost you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course.  How much?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Five full nights... days too? Edward nods.  Vivian hesitates... it's got to be enough t really change things... She shoots for the moon again.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Four thousand.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, may I point out five more nights at three hundred a night is only 1,500.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: But you want days too.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: All right, two thousand.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Holy shit. And then, quickly getting herself back together, she flip the sexy smile. VIVIAN (cont'd) Sugar, you got it.  I will treat you like a prince.  Anything, anyway you want.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm not just talking about sex.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Look butthead, I'll treat you so nice you'll never want to let me go, okay?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Three thousand for five days. And Vivian, I will let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward comes out into the bedroom.  Vivian quickly follow They move through the bedroom into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll be out most of the day. He reaches into his pocket for a money clip.  He peels of bills.  He hands the cash to Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I want you to go out and buy some decent clothes. Vivian's eyes go wide at the amount of money.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Nothing too flashy, not too sexy. Conservative.  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: INT. PENTHOUSE ENTRANCE WAY
dialogues.text: They're at the front door.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you want me to dress like your high class girlfriend. You're wasting your money though. All I'm gonna do is hang around the hotel.  As a matter of fact, I may never get out of that bathtub. Edward opens the door, he starts to exit.  He turns back.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Think again.  I'm taking you out to an important dinner with me tonight. The door closes in her face.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (from inside) What?  Are you crazy? Edward smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is stretched out in the hot bubble bath.  The TV i She clicks the remote control in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three thousand... She lies back into the soapy water and disappears.  She s pops back up, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three thousand! A thought occurs to her.  She reaches for the cordless ph She dials.  She waits.  She is about to disconnect when t phone is answered.

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: 'Lo.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Kit!  Where've you been?

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I was asleep.  You woke me.  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Kit, listen, the guy last night, the one in the Ferrari, I'm at this hotel, the Regent Beverly Wilshire, it's this absolutely unbelievable place and he's hired me for a whole week and Kit, listen, he's paying me three thousand bucks!  We can get out of the apartment.  We can get out of this town.  We can do anything! (silence) Kit?  Hey, you there?

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why'd he want you? That hurts.  Perhaps because Vivian's been wondering the thing.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: He... he just does.

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Viv'.  Carlos has been on my back. (a beat) Did you get the money up front like I taught ya'?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Three hundred for last night and he gave me extra to buy some clothes.  Now listen, I'm gonna leave an envelope for you at the front desk. Give me two hundred to the scum bucket and the other hundred to that asshole landlord for part of the rent.  Spend it on drugs and I'll pull your hair out.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I'm getting dressed now.  I'll be over.  Bye.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hey Kit, where do I go for the clothes?  Good stuff on him.

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (brightening) In Beverly Hills?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Baby!  Rodeo Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out of the elevator and crosses the lobby. is back in her hooker clothes.  She leaves an envelope at front desk. MR. THOMAS, the prim, middle-aged hotel manager, steps ou his office.  He stares in surprise and displeasure as he Vivian exit out the front door.  Vivian doesn't notice th stares she gets from two well-dressed MIDDLE-AGED WOMEN w just entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is looking wide-eyed and delighted and yes, more t a bit overwhelmed.  She passes store windows... and MORE WINDOWS... and still MORE STORE WINDOWS.  Each display is beautiful and expensive than the one before. Vivian is also aware that she is getting odd looks.  From PASSERBY'S.  Two beautiful dressed GIRLS her own age look her, turn away and giggle.  The uniformed GUARDS that sta attention in front of many of the stores, stare at her suspiciously. Feeling more and more uncomfortable, Vivian comes to a po woman's boutique.  She hesitates for a moment.  She enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is no sooner in the door than she is subject to th disapproving stare of a SALESWOMAN standing behind the co

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: (cooly) May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm just looking, thanks. Vivian tiptoes through the shop as if it was filled with delicate glass objects.  She cautiously examines a dress. Saleswoman quickly comes around the counter and approache

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Are you looking for something in particular?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yes.  Something... conservative.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Yes... Vivian eyes the Saleswoman, puzzled at her tone.  She exa a dress.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You have beautiful things. (no reply) How much is this?

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: I don't think it would fit you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (beginning to get the drift) I didn't ask if it would fit. I asked how much it was.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: It's very expensive. Vivian's body tenses as she stares at the Saleswoman.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What is with you?

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: (unblinking) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to spend money.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: I don't think we have anything for you here.  You're obviously in the wrong place. Vivian is speechless.  She turns and stomps toward the do She stops and spins around staring at the Saleswoman.  Vi flips her off.  She throws the door open and storms outsi The Saleswoman calmly strolls back to her counter and ret to her place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out onto the street and stands, lost.  She t a deep breath, trying to control herself.  Two WOMEN, in designer outfits, stroll by, eyeing Vivian as if she were freak.  Vivian suddenly feels naked.  She turns and hurri away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian enters the lobby, upset, nervous and paranoid.  Sh an emptiness in her stomach at the sight of all the luxur around her.  She hurries toward the elevators. At the front desk, Mr. Thomas, once again spots her.  He the lobby and deftly cuts her off from the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: May I help you Miss? Vivian stops, practically shaking with terror.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm just going to my room.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're a guest here?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm -- I'm with a friend.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: And who is that?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I... Edward... Vivian's face is filled with confusion.  She doesn't know name.  The elevator doors open behind them.  She spots th Operator.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (blurting it out) He knows me. Mr. Thomas turns and eyes the Operator curiously.  The Op looks back at them innocently.  With a smooth gesture Mr. waves the Operator over.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Do you know this young lady? The Operator nods.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: She's with Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (surprised) Mr. Harris?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: She apparently joined him last night. Mr. Thomas waves the Operator away.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Why don't you come with me.  We'll chat for just a moment. He takes Vivian gently but firmly by the arm and leads he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a richly furnished office, Mr. Thomas places Vivian in comfortable chair and then leans against the edge of his

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Miss Vivian... things that go on in other hotels don't happen at the Regent Beverly Wilshire. Vivian says nothing. MR. THOMAS (cont'd) Mr. Harris, however, is a very special customer.  And we like to think of our special customers as friends.  As a customer, we would expect Mr. Harris to sign in any additional guests.  But as a friend, we're willing to overlook it, I'm assuming you're a... relative? Vivian finds herself nodding. MR. THOMAS (cont'd) I thought so.  You must be his...?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Niece?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Of course.  Naturally when Mr. Harris leaves, I won't see you in this hotel again. Vivian bites her lower lip, nods. MR. THOMAS (cont'd) Good.  We understand one another. (as a gentle afterthought:) I would also encourage you to dress in a more appropriate manner. Vivian's face screws up as she tries hard not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: That's what I was trying to do. She can't help it, the tears come.  Vivian pulls out the Edward gave her.  She drops it on the desk.  It's a moist looking wad now. VIVIAN (cont'd) I was trying to get some other clothes... but... they wouldn't... they made me feel like shit... She can't go on.  Mr. Thomas politely glances at the mone He unfolds it, smoothes it and hands it back to her.  He He picks up the phone.  He dials.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Women's clothing. (beat) Bridget, please. Vivian is staring at him. MR. THOMAS (cont'd) Bridget, hello, this is Barnard Thomas over at the Regent Beverly Wilshire.  Well, thank you, that's flattering.  I'd like to ask a favor of you.  I'm going to send someone over.  Her name is Vivian. She's a guest of ours.  A very special guest. He glances at Vivian.  With those simple words, he'd made feel better. MR. THOMAS (cont'd) She's from out of town and she needs a little help in dressing. Perhaps you could help her out. Thank you very much.  She'll be right over. He sets the phone down and smiles patronizingly at Vivian MR. THOMAS (cont'd) There you are.  If you have any other problems, come ask for me personally.  I'm Mr. Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Barney. She smiles mischievously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek corporate helicopter flies over the port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, Vance, Stuckey and Jake walk toward the building' edge.  They look out over the empty shipyard as Vance des it.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Okay... this is the jewel in Kross's crown.  We can strip out all the heavy equipment.  Some of the cranes are very valuable overseas.  The Japanese are salivating for them.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Prime industrial property straddling the Port of Long Beach and Los Angeles.  It gives me a hard-on. Edward points toward one of the edges of the shipyard.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What's that long building over there?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Storage, I think.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Not with those smokestacks it's not.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Let me check. Vance pulls out a notebook.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: The real estate possibilities are endless.  Most of the yard we'll just level.  I talked to a couple of developers, under the table, of course, and they said

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I talked to some developers about the land.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: What kind of an idiot are you? You don't talk about this to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: They're close friends, they'd never breathe a word --

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (to Vance) Where did you dig this moron up?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: He's right, Jake, that was an incredibly stupid thing to do. It won't happen again, Edward. I'll pull him off the project immediately.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Don't bother.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We don't have the time to bring someone new up to speed. Besides... (not unkindly, to Jake) You've already impressed everyone you need to, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It won't happen again, Mr. Harris. Vance has found what he was looking for in his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: This is interesting.  That building is storage now, but it used to be a smelting plant.  They closed it down after World War II.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I want our lawyers to check into the toxic waste licences on them right away.  I want to know if the permits are still valid and what kind of limits are on them.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Jesus, yes.  It's a long shot but if the permits are still in effect, they're worth a fortune. He turns away.  The other follow Edward back toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What time's diner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock.  Kross is bringing his son.  Very bright kid, watch yourself with him.  Who's this girl you're taking?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No one you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and Vivian walks out and surveys the r nervously.  She walks toward the women's clothing section BRIDGET, a large friendly woman, spots her and quickly approaches.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: You must be Vivian. Vivian nods. BRIDGET (cont'd) Let's look at you... She steps back, regards Vivian with a professional eye. BRIDGET (cont'd) Where are you from, dear?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (pause) Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: No wonder.  For starts, you should know that hot pants are horrid, even when you do have the legs to carry them off.  What are your plans while you're in town?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well... I might be going out to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: You'll want a cocktail dress then.  Turn.  You have a beautiful figure.  A little too out in the open but simply lovely.  Size six? Do you need shoes?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I dunno.  Do thigh high, leather boots go with a cocktail dress?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: (calling out) Philip!  We'll need shoes! Bridget leads Vivian towards the racks of clothes.  She p out a dress.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Your uncle will like this.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: He's not really my uncle.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: They never are, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomas is behind the desk.  He looks up.  Vivian is s there, a happy look on her face.  She holds up a garment

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I got a dress.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (dryly) I rather hoped you'd be wearing it.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I didn't want to get it messed. I got shoes too.  Wanna see?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: That's all right.  I'm sure they're quite lovely.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: They were real nice to me there. They treated me, y'know... nice. Thanks, Barney. Mr. Thomas tries not to wince at the familiarity.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're very welcome, Miss Vivian. She smiles at him.  He watches as Vivian turns and walks the elevator.  The provocative way her hips move just nat attracts the attention of a MALE PASSERBY.  And the white ELEVATOR MAN literally leaps to press the elevator button Vivian who rewards him with a happy smile.  Mr. Thomas si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is ringing Vivian enters.  She hurries to pick

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hello? The phone keeps ringing -- it has more than one line.  Vi frantically punches buttons. VIVIAN (cont'd) Hello?  What?  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is in a private office.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Never answer the phone.  Ever.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Tsk, believe me, this will be the last time.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Did you buy some clothes?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I got a dress, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Just one?  Christ... I hope it's appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's very tasteful.  I think you'll especially like the zipper in the crotch. (silence) I'm -- joking.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let's hope so.  You'll get some more clothes tomorrow.  I'll be pushed for time so meet me in the hotel lobby at seven forty-five sharp.  Got it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No, I don't "got it".  Even the farmboys back in Georgia come to the door when they're taking you on a date.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: This isn't a date.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Go by yourself then.  Where you taking me anyway?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The Rex.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Any good?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think you'll approve.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: ... all right.  I'll meet you in the lobby.  But only cause you're paying me to.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thank you very much. Vivian slowly sets the phone down.  The phone rings again Vivian, very carefully, punches the flashing button and p it up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I thought I told you not to answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oooh! Edward hangs up.  He smiles to himself. Vivian bites her fingernails, looking nervous.  The doorb RINGS.  Vivian looks up, startled.  She rises, moves to a it. It's the Spanish MAID.  She nods politely at Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: Housekeeping.  I come to turn down the bed.  5:00, I turn down the bed.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What? The Maid points to her hotel badge, trying to explain.

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: Housekeeping.  I come to turn down the bed.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Okay. The Maid enters.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Is there a trick to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maid turns down the bedspread.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Is that all?  You just fold back the bedspread?

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: I also place las chocolates on the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Oooh, I love those.

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: I leave extras, miss.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Thanks!  Consuelo, are all rich people so lazy they can't do this on their own? Consuelo shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomas is still behind the desk, working when a soft startles him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Barney. He looks up.  He sighs.  Vivian still hasn't changed.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: What is it, Miss Vivian?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Edward is taking me to some fancy place for dinner.  The Rex.  Ever been there?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: It's a bit beyond my... range, shall we say.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, mine too.  Is it like, y'know, normal?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: I think you'll find it normal enough.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Will I like it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You'll like it fine.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Okay.  Thanks, Barney.  You're the best. She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Just mind which fork you use. Vivian turns abruptly back, a horrified look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Fork?

dialogues.speaker: PLACESETTING
dialogues.text: An elegant formal placesetting complete with a myriad of different size forks, spoons, stacked china plates and cr glassware.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS AND VIVIAN
dialogues.text: sit across from one another at a fully set table.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: In fifteen minutes I can teach you everything you need to know to dine with the Queen.  First, as you pick up the knife you shift your fork to the left hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: But I always eat like this.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Either you're European or badly brought up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hmmm... I vonder vich. (giggles)

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Actually, some of the richest people I know have the worst manners.  Of course, Mr. Harris, being of old money, knows his way around a table.  All right now, pay attention please.  Salad fork.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What if they serve soup?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: They will serve salad.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: But what if they serve soup?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Then you use your soup spoon.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) I like steak.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (picking up the appropriate utensil) Then you would use your--

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Steak spoon! (laughs) Mr. Thomas swallows his exasperation. WE PULL BACK from their table to reveal the cavernous, em banquets room, each table is set and ready for the dinner service.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Miss Vivian --

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll just order a burger, Barney, that way I can eat with my hands.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Miss Vivian... there's a salon here in the hotel.  Instead of worrying unnecessarily about table manners, why don't you just have your hair done instead?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Professionally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian sits in a salon chair.  The last customer, THANE, young man of about twenty with his long hair pulled back pony tail, tilts her head one way and then another, eyein professionally.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I have a friend who has a friend who does Cher's wigs.

dialogues.speaker: THANE
dialogues.text: I hate him already. (a beat) All set?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... what a ya say we chop it all off and bleach the tips.

dialogues.speaker: THANE
dialogues.text: Darling?  Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward enters and looks around the lobby.  No Vivian.  An Edward crosses to a house phone and picks it up.  He's ab to dial when:

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Harris. Edward looks at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Barnard Thomas, manager of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Of course, yes.  If you'll excuse me just a moment --

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: I have a message for you from your "niece", sir.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: The young lady staying in your room? Edward's eyes narrow.  He hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think we both know she's not my niece. Mr. Thomas looks uncomfortable. EDWARD (cont'd) Does this hotel have any problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris, a guest of yours, is a guest of ours and shall be treated accordingly.  The young lady asked me to tell you that she is waiting for you in the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thank you. He starts towards the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Very intriguing young woman, Miss Vivian. His tone stops Edward in his tracks. MR. THOMAS (cont'd) Have a good evening, sir. And off he goes, leaving Edward to wonder what the hell transpired during the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward enters the lounge.  He looks around, not seeing Vi And suddenly his eyes go back to... the beautiful girl wi beautifully styled hair in the beautiful black cocktail d at the piano bar.  Edward tries to hide his surprise as V rises, moves elegantly towards him.  She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're late. Such a beautiful woman deserves an apology and so, withou thinking:

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're forgiven. She waits expectantly.  He holds out an arm.  She takes i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out of the ladies room.  She walks forward p the MAITRE'D'S station.  She stops.  She takes a breath.. then walks forward.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN
dialogues.text: Vivian moves down a marble starircase, through the elegan restaurant toward a far table.  Her beauty and natural gr draw approving stares.  She is like a queen moving throug ballroom. At a secluded table, Edward sits in conversation with two JAMES KROSS, in his early 70's, a bulky self-made million industrialist.  Sitting next to him is his son and second command, DAVID KROSS, a handsome man in his early thirtie All of them rise as Vivian comes to the table.  David Kro holds out Vivian's chair for her.  Surprised, she nods he thanks.  In front of her is an enormous placesetting.  Sh smiles down at the utensils, filled with confidence. Waiters have placed a delicate salad down in front of eac them.  Vivian proudly reaches for her salad fork.  But th sees that Kross has picked up the fork closest to his pla is digging into his salad with that. Vivian looks to see what Edward will do.  He doesn't seem interested in eating yet.  Neither does David Kross.  Fee a sudden panic, Vivian puts her fork down.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: So young man, I understand you are trying to take over my company. A moment.  The abruptness of the question takes Edward ba a moment.  But then he almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Please don't patronize me, Mr. Kross.  Our ages mean nothing here. Kross and David look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris, we know you've purchased at least twenty percent of our stock.  We also know you plan to file a formal bid for a majority share.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Twenty-five percent.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris, I built Kross Enterprises myself.  I know every man who ever worked there by his first name.  I know their wives... and their children.  If your intention is to take over my company and turn it into a glorified real estate deal, think again. Edward, thankfully, now reaches for his salad fork and be to eat.  Relieved, Vivian picks up hers.  They all eat fo moment.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What do you suggest, Mr. Kross? WAITERS approach, some to clear the salad plates, some to down the next course.  Vivian, thinking she's got to fini quickly stuffs her mouth with the rest of her salad.  She reluctant to let the Waiter take her fork.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: What would it take to buy our stock back?  Name your price.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: To get me in a mood to sell -- double what I paid.  But your company doesn't have enough capital right now to buy anything.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're on the verge of closing a large navy contract.  Double is ridiculous but we can assure you a healthy profit on your shares.  We would give you a promissory note...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're not getting any navy contracts. Vivian can see that both father and son are stunned by th news.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There's no way you could know that.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: But I do know.  I also know your lines of credit are over-extended. If I don't buy your company, someone else will... (looking up) Ah, the escargot. Escargot are put down in front of everyone.  Vivian stare them dubiously.  She picks up what she assumes is the nex "right" fork.  She picks up a snail.  The two do not fit. Flustered, she doesn't know what to do.  No one else seem be eating.  And now a Waiter comes and places escargot fo at each place.  Vivian picks it up with a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (softly, to the Waiter) Scume me, what are these things?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: (bending to whisper) Escargot, mademoiselle.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (leaning close to whisper) Snails. Vivian stares at them, horrified.  She, like James and Da Kross, no longer seem interested in eating.  Edward eats pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Mr. Kross, I'm not here to sell you my stock.  On the contrary, I'm here to buy yours.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: (angry) You've got a lot of nerve.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No.  What I have is a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I know all about you, Mr. Harris. When you buy companies, they have a way of disappearing.  Even the pension funds are stripped clean. The last three companies you took over were cut up in so many pieces, widows were left without their retirement checks.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (calmly) What I did with those companies was perfectly legal.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I don't question the legality of what you do.  It's your morality that makes me sick.  I will not allow my company to be raped by a man like you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (angry now) It is not your company.  It's a public company.  And I am going to acquire it.  Either I buy from the other stock holders, or I buy from you. Vivian struggles with her escargot. EDWARD (cont'd) I would suggest that you and your board cooperate with me, rather than fight a battle you don't have the ammunition to win. Vivian suddenly ZINGS her snail across the table.  Everyo looks to her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Slippery little suckers... Kross rises.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: If you'll excuse me young lady, Mr. Harris... (turns to David) Deal with this, David, you know where we stand.  I need to go someplace and puke. He rises.  He exits.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Edward and Vivian) Men like my father built this country.  He was no saint.  He screwed people.  But for every guy he stepped on, he gave a hundred a good job. Edward is silent.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: He seems like a nice man. David looks at Vivian as if seeing her for the first time

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We can reach an understanding on this.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  You should know we're going to fight you with every resource we have.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do what you have to do.  I don't take it personally.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I do.  I take it all very personally. (to Vivian) Very nice meeting you, Vivian. David Kross gets up and leaves.  Vivian and Edward sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (a beat) And that's the way the game is played.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Some game.  Screwin' some poor slob out of his retirement. Edward says nothing.  But Vivian can see she's hit a nerv

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Snails for dinner.  No wonder everybody is in such a bad mood. A Waiter appears at the table.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Are we ready for the next course, sir?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No.  Bring a check, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward's face is pensive and thoughtful as he stares out the glass window down at the city lights.  He quickly dra his champagne glass.  Vivian moves to stand next to him. She refills his glass from the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thank you. He drinks.  Silence.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're upset, huh?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Upset.  No.  I never get upset about business.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You liked the guy, though.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Whether I liked him or not is irrelevant.  It's business. There's no emotion involved in business... if you want to survive.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (excited) We're the exactly the same!  Kit keeps telling me don't get emotional when you turn tricks -- that's why no kissing -- it's too personal. The key is like you're saying, stay numb, don't get involved -- when I'm with a guy, I'm a robot, I just do it. (realizing what she's saying and quickly recovers) Except with you.  At your price I give my all... Edward laughs. VIVIAN (cont'd) Let's not talks about this heavy stuff.  Come on, relax. Vivian comes up behind him.  She begins to rub his should

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: That... is very good. A moment.  Edward is silent.  Turns him, unknots his tie, unbuttons his collar.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Know what we're gonna do in a little while then?  We're gonna call Domino's and have'm deliver a bigass pizza.  We're gonna eat it in bed.  We're gonna veg' out and watch television.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Television?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's this box, it has pictures, sound.  You don't have to use your brain at all.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I have work to do.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
