dialogues.text: Uh-uh.  No work. Smiling, she softly kisses his throat. VIVIAN (cont'd) See... what you haven't figured out yet... She kissed his neck.  She fumbles with his belt. VIVIAN (cont'd) Is that while you're the boss everyplace else... I'm the one in charge here. She kisses his chest. VIVIAN (cont'd) You... just think you are. She starts to kneel down.  He stops her.  They stare at o another for a moment.  He releases her.  She smiles.  She starts to undress him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is asleep.  She turns over, slowly waking.  Her ha goes out to touch Edward and encounters nothing but empty Vivian comes awake with a sudden start.  She look around momentarily frightened, not sure where she is.  Sighing w relief, she lies back down.  She sees Edward's American E card on the pillow next to her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Wake up, Vivian.  Time to shop. Edward comes out of the bathroom and moves toward the bed He is tying his tie.  Vivian sits up and ties it for him. smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I still don't understand why you only bought one dress.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I wasn't as much fun as I thought it was going to be.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well, you know those cold bitches that work in those stores and try to intimidate you?  It works.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Was someone rude to you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I had a little problem in one store.  I wasn't dressed right. I don't know what to say.  I don't belong there.  Maybe I'll just go back to Bridget.  She was cool.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, you belong wherever you are.  I don't care how you were dressed, they were the ones who were wrong, not you. Edward sits on the bed. EDWARD (cont'd) People aren't going to respect you unless you respect yourself. (a beat) The next time someone is rude to you, you stare at them right here. He softly touches her, right between the eyes. EDWARD (cont'd) It's an old trick I use, especially with bankers.  Works every time.  Will you try it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (confidently) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (a beat) Come with me? Edward looks at his watch.  Vivian covers it with her han

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful, chic women's shop.  The haughty SALESGIRL approaches Vivian near a rack of dresses.  Edward hovers b.g.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (nervous) Hello.  Can you help me? The Salesgirl looks Vivian up and down.  A Pause.  Vivian her "the stare" and straightens up.  We see the Salesgirl reaction change.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (confidently) I'm looking for a dress, nothing too flashy, not too sexy, conservative.  In a size six.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable under Vivian's stare) Do... do you have a charge account with us? Vivian smiles and draws out Edward's American Express car The Salesgirl nods and quickly moves to a rack of dresses find Vivian's size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian tries on different clothes under Edward and the Salesgirl's supervision. Vivian comes happily out of the dressing room wearing a l cut, spangled and fringed outfit.  Edward shakes his hand Salesgirl holds a classic tweed ensemble over Vivian's ou Vivian scowls.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (sighing) I look like fucking Nancy Reagan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Salesgirl shows Edward clothes by Ann Taylor.  He tur to find Vivian happily holding up a tiny, low cut leather Edward shakes his head in mock disapproval.  Vivian scowl

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Vivian is wearing an elegant pastel dress.  Edward is sta at the store's bar, watching and talking on the telephone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuckey and Vance are pouring over stock reports, talking Edward on the speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Kross came out of his corner swinging.  He started buying up all available stock as soon as the market opened.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) He's a tough old son of a bitch... Edward is watching Vivian.  She pulls the hem of her skir to mid thigh.  She looks hopefully over to Edward.  Edwar shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: It's up to ten and a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Offer nine and a half.  Bring them back down to earth.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Goddamit!  Where is he getting the money to fight?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Someone's loaning it to him. Get on it right away.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Our contract guys are working on the Kross pension funds. There's another forty million there.  We can bleed'm dry. There is a sudden hesitation in Edward's eyes.  He watche Vivian tries on a hat.  She preens for him.  He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Vance & Stuckey) Put the pension funds on hold until I say otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (surprised) We're letting them slide?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I want the treatment plant licenses to be top priority right now.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: But, Edward...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Do it. Edward hangs up and takes a long look at Vivian.  She mov to him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch) You're on your own now, Vivian. I've got to get to work.  Be sensible and you can keep everything.  Spend too much and it all goes back. Vivian hugs him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian walks along Rodeo Drive.  She looks lovely in the dress and new, white shoes.  A pretty, white hat is the f touch.  She carries a bag containing her old clothes.  Sh at a trashcan and ceremonially throws the offending items

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEES Vivian in each department within the store with different SALESPEOPLE.  She happily and confidently tries a variety of dresses, hats, shoes, accesarries, etc. 1)  Vivian is in a dressing stall.  She tosses a dress ou to a waiting SALESWOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Not me! 2)  A SALESWOMAN holds a long, purple evening gown.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (imitating Bridget) Horrid! 3)  Vivian is admiring a pair of beautiful suede dress pu Her attention is drawn to the SALESMEN'S exotic hand-pain tie.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where'd you get your tie? 4)  Vivian stands in front of an enormous tie rack with t Salesman, a dozen wild, swirling designed ties are hangin his outstretched arm.  Vivian picks out the brightest one smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian's arms are filled with clothing boxes and bags.  S feels like she owns the block.  A well-dressed MAN passes smiling politely.  Vivian's nose lifts as she happily ign him. Suddenly Vivian stops.  She's about to pass the shop she thrown out of.  Vivian takes a breath and enters the shop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian enters.  The moment she steps through the door, Vi courage leaves her. The saleswoman is waiting on a CUSTOMER.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: (to the customer) Isn't this lovely?  I think it would look wonderful on you. Vivian musters her courage.  She takes a deep breath and forward.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: (to her customer) Would you like to try it on?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: 'Scume me. Both the saleswoman and her customer look up.  The salesw smiles pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I was in here yesterday. Vivian slowly raises her middle finger.  The recognition to dawn in the saleswoman's eyes.  Vivian's courage begin return.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That's right.  It's me. I want you to know something. You made me feel terrible. I wasn't dressed right and you said I didn't belong here.  Well, I do.  You're the one that was wrong, not me.  And I want to tell you something else.  I'm never gonna shop here again as long as I live. And with that, Vivian turns and walks out. The saleswoman is stunned.  A beat.  The customer thrusts dress into the saleswoman's arm as if offended by Vivian' speech and leaves the store also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomas looks up from the desk.  And stares.  Vivian a BELLHOP stroll through the hotel entrance and across the lobby to the elevator.  The bellhop's arms are packed wit and shopping bags.  Mr. Thomas can't help it.  He smiles himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian opens the front door for the Bellhop who carries i packages.  She motions for him to place them on the couch does.  Vivian happily tips him with a five dollar bill. exits.  The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Wheee!!! Vivian does a giddy spin and falls onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuckey enters.  Edward is standing at the end of a long meeting table.  He is serving himself coffee from a tray.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (gloating) You were right.  Kross mortgaged everything he has down to his grandson's college tuition to secure loans from a bank.  Not just any bank.  One we do business with. Edward just sips his coffee. STUCKEY (cont'd) It goes without saying that your business means a great deal more to them than our friend Kross's. (a beat) All you have to do is make a call. Edward is silent.  Stuckey is again surprised.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me for saying this but what is wrong with you this week? First, you go soft on the pension funds.  Now, you're giving him the chance to get away?  As of two minutes ago, you are committed to the tune of over fifty million dollars --

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Come on, Bill, don't talk to me about how much money's involved. It's my money.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: And some of it's mine.  Edward, his jugular's exposed. Edward hesitates.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Get the bank on the phone for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward enters.  He closes the door.  He turns.  And stops beautiful, candlelit, food laden table has been set up in middle of the room.  Champagne and wine chills in a bucke A fire burns in the fireplace.  Music is playing.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi. Edward turns.  And stares again.  Vivian stands in the be doorway.  She is wearing an exquisite silk dressing gown. looks incredibly beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I thought maybe you'd like dinner.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I would. (he fingers her dressing gown) Nice.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Wait till you see what I have on underneath.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Please. She opens the dressing gown.  What she has on underneath absolutely nothing.  Edward crosses to her.  Taking her i arms, he lifts her up and kisses her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What about dinner?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Dinner can wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom is lit by candles.  Vivian and Edward are in marble tub.  Vivian sits behind Edward.  She lazily washe shoulders and back with a large sponge.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You always been rich?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Seems like it.  I guess it's easy to get used to, huh?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Easier than learning how to be poor. (a moment; and then:) My father's family was wealthy. When I was young there were cars and houses, private schools, nannies.  But then my father divorced my mother to marry another woman.  And he took his money with him. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Keep talkin'.  I like hearin'.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Not much to tell.  I went to public school.  Went to university on scholarship.  Went to work for an investment firm. In eight years I owned it. (and then; growing very quiet) My father was chairman of the board of the third company I ever went after.  I swallowed that company and shit out the pieces. One of the pieces was him. Vivian softly traces small patterns on Edward's shoulders a finger.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You still mad at'm?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: He died a long time ago. She gently rests her head on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING BELLIES  People are sunbathing by the pool. Overweight... lobster red... old and stretch-marked... fi white... and then gorgeous.  The gorgeous is Vivian.  She wearing a miniscule bikini and sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Miss Vivian? She looks up.  A young WAITER, looking a little dry-mouth the sight of her, is holding a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: You have a call.  Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (taking the phone) Hi, baby. (a moment) I'll be ready.  Bye. She hangs up.  She looks at the Waiter, confused.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What do you wear to polo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horses and riders crash and careen on the playing field. enthusiastic crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN OFF THE EDGE OF THE FIELD
dialogues.text: a tailgate party using Cadillacs and Rolls Royces is in progress.  Horses and riders thunder by a crowd of very well-dressed, successful-looking people -- celebrities, e socialites, aficionados -- most of whom ignore the game. are there to see and be seen much more than to watch a po match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian and Edward make their way towards the party.  Edwa wearing his new tie.  Vivian is looking very chic and bea in one of her new outfits.  Not that it's helping -- the the people, the wealth -- everything here suddenly has he overwhelmed.  She suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You're really pushing it, bringing me here.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think it's exciting.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What id we run into someone I know?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I really doubt anyone here frequents Hollywood Boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You did. A VOICE calls out.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Edward! They turn.  William Stuckey is with a group of people.  H them over. STUCKEY (cont'd) Come on!  Over here! Edward takes Vivian's arm and leads her forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuckey grins and shakes Edward's hand.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (looking at Vivian) Well, well, well... Vivian dislikes this guy on sight.  Dislikes the frosty l woman at his side.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Bill, I'd like you to meet Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (holding out a hand; smiling) Bill Stuckey, Vivian.  My wife, Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi. Elizabeth Stuckey stretches her thin lips in a cold smile

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Lots of fun people here.  Let me get you two some champagne. He moves quickly away.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. She moves to greet someone else.  Vivian and Edward surve milling CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Real genuine guy.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: He's good at what he does.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You could freeze ice on his wife's ass.  She anything like your ex?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (a small smile) Shall we mingle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A goal is scored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward watches and guides her, Vivian sips champagne and and chats and wins over different PEOPLE.

dialogues.speaker: LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: A group of PEOPLE.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I simply love your dress, Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: This old thing?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Of course, a figure like yours can wear anything.  You must work out constantly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I lead a very physical life.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: Are you into running, Vivian?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm into walking.  I walk a lot.

dialogues.speaker: LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: In another group of PEOPLE.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER MAN
dialogues.text: You look awfully familiar, Vivian. Haven't we run into one another at the spa in La Costa?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well, I do often spa there.

dialogues.speaker: LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: Edward and Elizabeth Stuckey watch Vivian laugh and chat a group of WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Edward, she's marvelous.  Warm and witty and down to earth.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (with pleasure) She is, isn't she.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH STUCKEY
dialogues.text: So unlike your usuals.  Where on earth did you find her? Edward smiles enigmatically.  Taking an hors d'oeuvres of passing WAITERS's tray, he starts forward.

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN
dialogues.text: We're good together.  He has to admit it.  I've been just what he wants me to be.  I say the right things, I know the right people, I give wonderful parties. No question, no arguments, no embarrassments.  It works for both of us. That makes Vivian think.  And then she smiles as she sees approaching.  Vivian moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Edward, these women here, I don't think any of'm like the guys they're with.  They're just into it for the money.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sure that's true for some of them.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I thought I was the pro.  These women make me feel like an amateur.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (a beat) Ready to stomp sod?

dialogues.speaker: IN A SERIES OF SHOTS TO MUSIC
dialogues.text: The CROWD engages in sod stomping.  They drink champagne. make a dance out of it.  They laugh.  Shoes get stuck in mud.  It's ludicrous -- these people in their suits and f clothes, replacing divots and stepping over the horse shi In a corner of the field, grazing horses stare, seemingly disbelief. Vivian is having a wonderful time.  And then, as she move towards the outside of the crowd she sees someone staring her from over among some of the riders and grazing horses David Kross smiles at Vivian.  She hesitates... and then crosses towards him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID KROSS
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi.  I never thought stomping in grass could be so much fun.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (laughs) I like your hat.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Huh?  Oh... yeah.  S'okay? (pleased; a moment) Uhm... how're... business things going.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Let's not talk about it, it's too depressing.  Come on, I'll show you Thunder.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Please, we hardly know each other.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Thunder's a horse.  Come on.

dialogues.speaker: LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: They approach the sweating mount.  David Kross caresses t horses muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey, big guy, you getting tired, yet?  I am.  This is Vivian. (a beat; and then:) You two been together long?  You and Edward?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hope to be? To Vivian's surprise, the question causes a pang inside.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's... it's not like that.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I see.  Well.  Maybe that means you'd have lunch with me sometime then. Vivian is suddenly silent.  She looks away. DAVID (cont'd) I'm sorry, am I being too forward?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'd like to find out.  You don't know anything about me either. That's why people have lunch. But something holds Vivian back, a feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William Stuckey turns... stops... stares.  He sees Vivian David Kross standing together.  He stares, his mind racin anxious, angry look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuckey has Edward off to the side.  He is talking to him a low, earnest voice.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Fill me in on this.  How'd you and Vivian meet?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We just did.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (grinning) Come on, you can tell me.  I sure would like to know where a guy runs into a girl as attractive as this.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The night I left your house, I was lost.  I was looking for directions.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: And you just happened to run into her.  Great.  What's she do?  She work?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian's in sales.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Sales, really?  That's great. What does she sell? Edward's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Hear me out.  I've known you a long time.  I see a difference in you this week.  Like that tie. I'm suddenly wondering if this girl's not the difference. Especially when I see her talking with David Kross.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Vivian turns away from the bar, now holding two glasses o champagne.  She scans the crowd for Edward.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She met him at dinner last night... I like this tie.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: So now they're best friends? Edward, this girl appears out of nowhere and now I see her talking to a guy whose company we're trying to buy.  It's too convenient.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're being ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Industrial espionage is not ridiculous.  Edward, how do you know she hasn't attached herself to you so she can bring Kross back information?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Christ, Bill, she's not a spy, she's a hooker.  I picked her up off Hollywood Boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: as she hear loud sudden LAUGHTER.  She turns.  She sees t it's Stuckey laughing.  Smiling, Vivian starts towards th two glasses of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: I swear to God, you are the only millionaire I ever heard of who'd go looking for a goddam bargain streetwalker! Edward sees Vivian coming.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let's drop it, shall we? Edward turns.  He smiles gently as Vivian quietly approac and hands him his glass of champagne. A group of BUSINESSMEN are standing a short distance away One of them calls out:

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Edward!  May we have your opinion on something?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to Vivian and Stuckey) Excuse me a moment. He moves to join the group of men.  Stuckey gives Vivian broad smile.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Having a good time, Vivian?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: All this must be quite a change from Hollywood Boulevard. Vivian looks as if she's been struck.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: It's okay.  Edward told me.  Your secret's safe with me. Stuckey runs his hand up her arm. STUCKEY (cont'd) What do you charge, Vivian? Maybe you and I could get together after Edward leaves.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (forcing a bitter smile) Yeah.  Sure.  Why not.  Call me at the Regent Beverly Wilshire.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: I just might do that. He moves away.  Vivian turns.  Edward looks up from his conversation, sees her looking at him.  He smiles, raises glass in a small toast.  A moment.  Vivian toasts him bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.  Edward switches on a light.  Vivian comes do steps into the room.  Edward follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're awfully quiet.  You haven't said a word since the party. As Edward touches her shoulder, Vivian suddenly spins and explodes with anger.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You asshole!  I can't believe what a --!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, what the -- Tears well in Vivian's eyes as she yells at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Clean the slut up, take her out, huh?!  What are you trying to prove!?  I'm not a piece of meat for you to offer to your friends!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've been with stinking old men who've made me want to puke but I've never had anyone make me feel as dirty as you did tonight.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Would you please calm down.  Tell me what happened.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Stuckey!  He wants an "appointment" with me after you leave.  You my pimp now or did he think that up on his own? Edward looks guiltily away.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to do? (a beat) I told the truth.  Why should the truth upset you?  It's not as if you're from a convent.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I want my fucking money.  I'm getting out of here.  I don't want anything more to do with you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Can we talk about this?  Can you just try to calm down?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Your goddamned friend, he thinks the only reason I'm with you is for the money. A tear falls from Vivian's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (defiantly) Well, it's true.  Just pay me what you owe me and I'm gone.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Pay me!  Before I pick up this chair and smash your face in.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Fine.  I'm only here a couple of more days and I'm not going to spend them fighting with you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll call you a cab.  If you want the clothes, pack them up. Vivian stands quietly for a moment.  And then she turns a walks into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian starts roughly picking up her clothes in the dim l of the bedroom.  As she does she starts crying.  With eac of clothing the tears come down harder.  Edward appears a doorway.  His face is genuinely concerned.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian... I'm sorry.  I wasn't prepared for questions about us. It was an idiotic and insensitive thing I did.  I should have known that it would hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm not hurt.  It doesn't hurt you when somebody pisses on you, it just pissed you off.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I really am sorry. Vivian lets the clothes fall from her arms.  Sobbing, she limply.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You hurt me. Edward goes to her and wraps his arms around her shoulder She touches his hand.  He sits on the bed.  He pulls her and wraps his arms around her, holds her tight.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, carrying a briefcase, moves jauntily down a long hallway.  Stuckey trails after him.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: This is no time to disappear. We're in too far.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Bill?  Stop panicking.  Kross isn't going anywhere and I don't need to spend the rest of the day watching his stock go down.  I'll be in the office tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Promise me you'll read those contracts by then.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Bill. Stuckey stops.  He calls after Edward.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Shit... By tomorrow, Edward! Edward hurries on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward exits out of his limo and walks to the front doors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward smiles, moving jauntily to the elevators.  Mr. Tho at the front desk notices Edward's happy mood.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Afternoon. Edward's attention is taken by the glittering jewelry dis in the hotel jewelry store window.  He detours from the elevators and moves to the window for a closer look.  He a moment and enters the jewelry store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out of the bedroom into the living room wear an elegant red sequined evening dress.  She looks incredi beautiful.  She sees the phone.  A thought occurs to her going to it, she picks it up.  Waits.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: C'mon, Kit... No answer.  She hears someone at the door.  She hangs up. Edward enters.  He is carrying a small case.  He stops at sight of Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Do I look okay?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (a small smile) Hmm... let's see... no, there's something missing. He holds up the small case.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I don't want you to get too excited... these are on loan... however... Vivian's jaw drops.  Edward is holding a diamond and ruby necklace in his hands, holds it as if it might melt if he breathed too hard.  Edward behind Vivian, fastens the necklace around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: This is made for a princess. I think she'd approve of you wearing it tonight.  There. Come look. He leads her to a mirror.  She stares at her reflection.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Edward, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Shush.  Of course you can.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What if I lose it?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You won't.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What if someone tries to steal it?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll guard them and you with my life.

dialogues.speaker: EDT. BURBANK AIRPORT
dialogues.text: A limo pulls onto the tarmac at Burbank Airport.  A PILOT a leather jacket and sunglasses hurries forward to open t door.  Edward -- now wearing evening clothes -- and Vivia out of the limo.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Your plane is ready to go, Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Very good.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Plane? Taking her arm, Edward leads her across the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You don't want to go all the way to San Francisco in a limousine, do you?  I don't.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Where are you taking me!?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: To meet some friends.  Rudolpho, a poet... Benoit, a landlord... Mimi, a flower maker...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: The opera. Up ahead is a waiting private jet, its engines already HU She is speechless.  Edward grins, loving the look on her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corporate jet takes off down the landing strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian are alone in the passenger lounge of th Vivian can't believe the cabin.  It is a comfortable room featuring a long couch that curves across two walls, buil bar, television and stereo.  Edward is once again, going papers.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I've never been on a plane before.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm glad you like it.  Now be quiet, I've really got to read these. Vivian fluffs her hair up.  She makes a happy, excited gr sound -- Rrrrr!  A wicked gleam comes to her eye. She walks over to Edward and stands in front of him.  He up.  She parts the thigh high slit in her gown to expose quarters.  She begins to unfasten the garters one at a ti

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, what do you think you're doing? Edward watches silk stockings slide down Vivian's lovely

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Being quiet. She reaches out and gently caresses Edward's face.  Edwar down his papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The setting sun casts an incredibly glow over the city an coast.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You ever been in love with anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is at the window, looking out.  She carefully puts earrings back on.  She stares, mesmerized by the skyline, golden gate bridge in the distance.  She turns.  Edward i buttoning his shirt.  He is silent.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Sorry.  You're not paying me to ask you question like that.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian.  I'm paying you to be you.  Be you. (a beat) Have you?  Ever been in love with anyone?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You mean, besides Elvis? (turning back to the window) I'm a human being.  Sure.  Once. First time I ever ran away from home, I got as far as Atlanta. I met this boy.  He'd been with his parents on their way to Chicago.  They stopped at a gas station.  He went to the john. When he came back they'd split. We sorta started looking out for each other.  Aw, he was sweet. And boy, was he good looking, y'know, dark hair and eyes. The chicken hawks were on him all the time.  He hated that. Sometimes we'd find a safe place to crash nights and we'd curl up together and we'd talk about all these crazy things.  The two of us getting married someday. Having kids.  Stupid stuff.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What happened to him? A moment.  Vivian shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: My father found me.  Dragged me home.  I don't know why, he never seemed to like me much when I was there. (a bitter smile) 'Cept when he was drunk, then he liked me a whole lot. (a moment) I made it back to Atlanta a year later.  Andy was gone. Silence.  Vivian stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Aw, but things sure look fine when you're sitting way up high. Edward moves close to Vivian and putting an arm around he shoulders, stares with her out at the view.  Vivian rests head against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airport limo pulls to a stop in front of the San Franc Opera House.  The DRIVER walks around back and opens the passenger door.  Edward emerges and helps Vivian out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward puts his hand on Vivian's elbow as they walk throu the elegant lobby.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Some people say that opera is an acquired taste, but I don't believe it.  You can always tell when someone goes to the opera for the first time.  They either love it or hate it.  Those who love it will always love it; those who hate it might come to appreciate it, but they'll never truly love it. Vivian is wide eyed as they walk past a beautifully lit fountain with several graceful statues in its center. Everywhere she looks she sees elegantly dressed WOMEN and prosperous looking MEN.  It makes her nervous.  Without realizing it, she raises a protective hand up to her neck She looks as if she suspects someone is going to step up steal it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Viv?  I really doubt if anyone here is going to try and grab it. Vivian reluctantly lowers her hands.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A crowd of PEOPLE mill around the lobby, heading toward t seats.  Vivian is aware of the looks she draws as she pas -- curious, even envious looks from the WOMEN, appreciati glances from the MEN.  Her hands again rises nervously to necklace.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: They all think you look very beautiful, Vivian. Vivian gives him a grateful look.  Relaxing, she lowers h from the necklace.  With a flourish, he offers his arm. takes it.  They start forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian take their seats in a box high above th stage.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: If it's in Italian, how will I know what they're saying?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll whisper some of the main parts of the story to you.  But you'll be surprised how much you understand.  The music conveys the story more powerfully than any words.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: But don't they have it in English?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, don't be afraid of what you don't know.  That's the fun of it. The lights dim.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (resigned) Okay.  Even if I hate it, I'm glad you brought me. The orchestra begins to play.  Vivian's eyes focus intens on the stage, as if a new world is about to be revealed t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN A MONTAGE OF IMAGES AND MUSIC - LA BOHEME is performed The lights from the stage dance across Vivian's face.  Ed leans over to translate the tenor's aria.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What am I?  I am a poet.  Not a man of wealth but one rich in dreams.  You have come to replace my vanished dreams.  I dwell now only in your eyes. The MUSIC ebbs and swells.  The sets and costumes change. story continues. Edward again leans close to Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: And now she asks Rudolpho if he still thinks her beautiful -- Vivian raises a hand and gently covers Edward's mouth.  H are fixed on the stage.  She doesn't need his help. The emotions building inside Vivian swell as the music is reaching its tragic climax.  Her lips tremble.  Her eyes with tears.  Edward glances at her.  He studies her a lon moment, watching the emotions play unashamedly across her Strangely moved, he takes Vivian's hand. As the opera ends, they are both swept away by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the lights come up, Vivian wipes off her tear-ruined mascara.  She sighs, happy.  The WOMEN in the next box sm at her.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: Did you enjoy the opera, dear?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (tearfully) It was so beautiful I just about pissed my pants. Edward smiles at the now shocked looking Older Woman and and the still misty Vivian exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and Vivian sit side by side.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: If you'd gone on about how much you liked it, I'm not sure I'd have believed you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I more than liked it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I know.  I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes.  I've never enjoyed it more. Thank you. Vivian looks at him a moment.  And then, leaning slowly f she kisses him gently on the mouth.  He looks at her surp He puts his arms around her and kisses her back.  It is t first time they've kissed and they make it very special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane flies in the night.  Back to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN A SERIES OF CROSS FADES Edward and Vivian make love. Equally giving, equally taking.  No masks, no shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkened bedroom, Edward and Vivian lie together. Edward cradles Vivian.  Her back rests against his chest. arm is over her body. She takes Edward's hand in her hands and carefully examin it; marveling at the fingers, the tiny hairs on the back. gently kisses the palm.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Love you... She clutches Edward's hand tightly to her breast.  She cl her eyes, ready to sleep now.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: His eyes open.  Vivian's whispered endearment has filled him with sudden confusion and uncertainty.  He stares int dark, wondering what to do with the woman in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings.  Edward immediately reaches out and pick up.  He is dressed in a robe.  Breakfast is on the umbrel table in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuckey, not even dressed yet, paces around his desk.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Did I wake you?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm up.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: I had to call.  I jus got off the phone with James Kross.  Get this.  He wants to see you. Today.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: He wouldn't say.  Edward... I think we got him.  His nuts are on the block and we got him. (silence) You there?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Give me twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: We'll be there.  Listen, if he's really caving in, we'll go from there down to the office.  I want him to commit his stock to us this morning. Edward hangs up.  His mind seems on other things.  He ris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is still asleep.  She is face down on the bed, the sheets just covering her to her waist.  Edward stares dow her.  He gently reaches out and runs a finger down the so of her spine.  Vivian murmurs contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Mmm. (opening her eyes; looking at him) Hi. Edward smiles at her softly.  And then:

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Better get dressed.  We're having guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is wearing her yellow dress.  She stares at hersel the bedroom mirror.  Her hair... her make-up... she reali how different she is now, realizes that she likes it. Edward comes out of the bathroom.  He crosses to the clos for a tie.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Here.  Let me. She comes over, starts to tie his tie for him.  He is ver aware of the closeness of her.  She smiles at him.  He sm puts his hand on her stopping her for a moment.  Looking she sees that he is serious now; no more jokes.  He relea her hand.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (quietly) One more night and you're finally rid of me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you've been pretty tough to take.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I have to go to New York tomorrow. Vivian says nothing. EDWARD (cont'd) But I'll be back in Los Angeles. Soon.  I'd like to see you again. I thought we could work out something... An arrangement. Vivian is silent. EDWARD (cont'd) I'll get you an apartment, buy you a car -- Vivian sighs, letting something go inside.  Finished with tie, she turns away. EDWARD (cont'd) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (not unkindly) What else?  You gonna leave some cash by the bed when you pass through town?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It wouldn't be like that.  I want to get you off the street.  You'll have a different kind of life. What's wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  That's very sweet, Edward, and I know you mean it... She is silent.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, I've thought about this a lot.  This is the best solution.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (shakes her head "no," then continues tying his tie) When I was a little girl, my mother locked me in the attic when I was bad, which was pretty often. I'd stare out the window up there and make believe I was a princess trapped in the tower by the wicked queen.  Then suddenly a knight on a white horse with his bright colors flying would ride up. Rescue me from the tower, and then we'd ride off... but never, ever in all the times I had that dream did the knight say, "Come on baby, I'll put you up in a great condo." She finished his tie.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, life's not a fairy tale.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (softly; to herself) I know. (a beat) Hey, don't mind me.  I'm being stupid. (more) I'll think about it, okay?  It's a real good offer for a whore.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I've never treated you like a whore.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (not mean) You just did. The doorbell suddenly rings in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward enters the living room.  Vivian slowly enters behi him.  Edward opens the front door.  Mr. Kross slowly ente He looks very old and tired; so much so that Edward has t his surprise.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How are you, Mr. Kross.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Not bad for a man who hasn't slept in four nights.  I'll get used to it. An angry, reluctant looking David Kross is behind his fat Stuckey brings up the rear.  Edward and David give one an perfunctory nod.  Stuckey smugly winks at Edward.  Edward the door and leads them all down the stairs. Vivian is very troubled at Kross's appearance.  He gently at Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Young lady.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hello. (to David) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hello, Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Let's not waste time here, shall we?  Mr. Kross, you said this morning, you wished to speak with Mr. Harris.  Mr. Harris is now listening. Kross has to fight down his humiliation at Stuckey's tone turns to Edward.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Yes.  I'm here to tell you that I've reconsidered my position on your acquisition offer.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Expected... offer.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Of course, yes.  After the expected filing period is over, I'm going to recommend to the board that we accept your bid.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (a moment) You're making the right decision, sir. Stuckey glances triumphantly at Edward.  He is surprised see that there doesn't seem to be any victory in Edward's Edward is silent.  Kross interprets his silence as second thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I'll see you on one condition. I'm not so concerned for me but the people who have worked for me... Vivian is disturbed watching this tired looking man.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (quickly) They'll be taken care of.  Won't they, Edward? Kross ignores Stuckey.  He looks to Edward.  Edward slowl nods.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I'll sign anything you want then.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Today. Kross nods tiredly.  His voice is very soft.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Today. Vivian abruptly turns and disappears into the bedroom, obviously upset.  The men all watch her go.  Edward hesit He turns to Kross:

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Excuse me, please? He heads to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is sitting on the bed, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hello.  Is Kit DeLuca there? When she comes in will you have her call Vivian Wells at 560-30000. Yes.  Okay. She hangs up as Edward comes in.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: What did you do to him?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Last time I saw him he was this strong guy.  Now he's beaten. And you liked him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian, I want you to listen to me.  The man realized that it would be better for his future and his son's future, if he cooperated.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's not your concern.  It's... business, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Business.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes.  The man made a business decision.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's all just business to you. Him.  Me.  Your life. Everything's business.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It's what I do for a living. It's how I make money. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a few hours. We'll talk about this later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward enters the living room.  The men look at him expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: We'll continue this down at the office. He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian stands at the railing, unhappily looking out at th beyond.  The phone RINGS.  She turns and hurries inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Lo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomas is standing behind the front desk, a rather st expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Barnard Thomas here.  Miss Vivian, I wonder if you might come down to the front desk.  There's someone here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: I'd send them up, but sadly, I don't trust the young lady to find you on her own. A hand reaches out and wrenches the phone away from Mr. T Kit, heavy make-up, skimpy outfit, chewing gum, cigarette all, keeps her voice just below a bellow.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Viv?  Where are you, babe? (glaring at Mr. Thomas) The sphincter-police won't let me through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit finishes slurping on a big, frosty ice cream soda.  S smacks her lips like a happy, little girl.  Vivian isn't anything.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm glad you're clean but I've been calling and calling.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Was that you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Who did you think?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Carlos.  I still owe him two hundred bucks...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Kit, I left that money for you days ago.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I just got it. An OLDER COUPLE walk past the table.  They stare at Kit.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks, grampa.  For seventy-five, the wife can watch. Horrified, the elderly couple hurry away.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Kit...

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Everybody keeps starin' at me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... I know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What do you know?  You look good. All dressed up. (meaning it) You clean up real nice. (giggling) You sure don't fit in down on the Boulevard, lookin' like you do.  Not that you ever did anyway.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You think I fit here where they just about chew your food for you?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Where do you fit? Vivian is silent, then.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (suddenly) I kissed him, Kit.  On the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Honey, you're not supposed to do that.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I know.  I stopped pretending and started liking it with him for real.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Oh, my god, you mean it was good?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (miserably) It was great.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Dummy.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: He wants to set me up in a place, give me some money.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I pray for that.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (nods) All I'm doing is feeling lousy about it.  I don't know what to do.  What do I do, Kit?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Go for the bucks.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I don't care about bucks. (a beat) I might love this guy.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Wow, are you in deep shit. (a sigh) You know he'll break your heart. Vivian is silent again. KIT (cont'd) I blame myself here.  First time I laid eyes on ya', I knew you were too complicated to be a whore. Vivian nods.  Her face is filled with confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward stands at the window looking out.  There is someth about his somber demeanor that both reflects the look we' seen on Vivian and suggests the way we saw him at the top the story. Jake enters, a pile of papers under his arm.  He begins l them out on the conference table.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Congratulations, sir.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Mr. Kross is just getting off the phone with his stock broker. It's finished.  You've won. Edward says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Who are you going after next, sir?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Who indeed... He turns as Stuckey, James and David Kross, and Vance ent the room.  They surround a conference table.  Kross sits, papers laid out in front of him.  Stuckey hands Kross a p A SECRETARY lays out finger food.  They wait for her to l before they speak.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: If we can get these letters of intent out of the way now... Mr. Harris and I would like to ask you some questions about your company.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Dad, excuse me, but that's inappropriate.  You're under no obligation to answer any questions at all.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Could we at least wait till after the filing period? Stuckey glances to Edward for help.  Edward is silent; in it's as if something is twisting inside of him.  Stuckey ahead.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris is preparing a bid based on our speculation of the corporation's net worth.  The price he ultimately pays for your father's stock will be based on that bid.  The more we know, the higher our bid can be.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: It's in my best interest to cooperate, David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: If he throws himself on your sword, you promise to take care of him and his family, huh? David stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: That's unfair!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You bed it is. (to Edward) You're everything he said you were. (to his father) Do what you have to do, Dad. Just don't expect me to watch it. He exits.  A moment.  Kross looks at Edward with a resign smile.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: He's young.  He hasn't learned how to lose gracefully yet.  I'll sign your papers.  And I'll answer your questions.  Whatever you want. He sighs.  He picks up the pen.  He's about to sign.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Stop.  For just a moment. (a moment) Mr. Kross, I'd like to ask you a few questions before you sign. You realize that you're a target. If you weren't mine, you'd be someone elses, correct?

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: If you had a... reprieve, what would do?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (quickly) I don't think there's any sense in --

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Let him answer.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I... I would take advantage of it.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How? Kross looks uncertain.  He gropes for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: I... I don't know.  There... there wasn't time...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I suppose you'd find out soon enough that you have assets you presently don't seem aware of, wouldn't you?  The waste processing licenses at that abandoned shipyard of yours, you'd certainly find out about that. Surprise suddenly flares in Stuckey's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Oh, my god... Edward, no!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I suppose you'd use them as collateral on new loans, wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: (to Stuckey) Quiet. (to Edward) Would I get the loans?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: This time I imagine you would, yes. (as if thinking about it) Hmm... (a moment) With all this in mind, Mr. Kross, I can't logically make a formal bid on your company, can I?

dialogues.speaker: KROSS
dialogues.text: (a small smile) You'd be initiating a financial battle you'd ultimately lose, Mr. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're very right.  I think the best thing we could all do is go home.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Have a good day, gentlemen. He exits from the room.  Stuckey follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is walking down the hall.  Stuckey comes out of th office and calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (calls) Edward, what happened?  What kind of move was that? Edward silently goes into the elevators.  The doors close

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: (yells) Dammit Edward, speak to me. Stuckey heads back to the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward comes out of the building.  His Chauffeur leaps to the limo door.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: No... take the car back to the hotel.  I need to walk. He sets off across Century Park East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian is in the living room, pacing, edgy, the doorbell She turns.  It rings again. She opens it.  Stuckey is standing outside with a small briefcase.  He looks agitated.  He tries to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Well, well... Hello again.  I'm looking for Edward. Vivian just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Edward's not back.  I thought he was with you. Stuckey walks past her and down the steps into the living

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: No, I'll just have to wait then, won't I? There is a bar set up.  Stuckey sets his briefcase down. crosses to the bar. STUCKEY (cont'd) Mind if I have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: No. He pours liquor in a glass.  He fires it down.  It seems calm him a bit.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Do you want to know what he did? Do you want to know what the crazy son of a bitch did?  He handed the whole thing back to Kross! On a silver platter.  For no reason!  What was he thinking, I mean, what was going through his goddam head?  Why? (pours another drink) What was all that benevolent crap?  What are we going to become, a philanthropic foundation?  I'll probably be the director of several worthwhile charities.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I think it's great. Stuckey glares at Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: I bet.  A lousy whore and you're the gum in a hundred million dollar deal.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (mocking) Aw, come on, Bill.  It's just business. He looks at her a moment.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: But what do I know, maybe you're worth it.  Come on, show me. Let's see your act. He grabs her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  I'll pay for it. What a you charge?  Huh?  Twenty, thirty, fifty bucks, maybe?  Are you a fifty dollar whore? He tries to kiss her and pulls her down on the couch on t of him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? She bites his hand.  Stuckey slaps her.  Vivian starts fl back.  But Stuckey is too strong.  Vivian staggers back a force of another slap.  Stuckey slams her up against a wa starts rubbing up against her.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: You got a mean streak in you, don't you. He tries to kiss her again. STUCKEY (cont'd) Is that what he likes about you? Huh?  Answer me! And suddenly a HAND lands on Stuckey's shoulder.  Stuckey his head, startled. INT. PENTHOUSE - REVERSE ANGLE - STUCKEY'S P.O.V. Edward, murder in his eyes, belts Stuckey across the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuckey falls on the ground.  Edward rushes forward, bers with rage, to hit Stuckey again.  His fist hits the top o Stuckey's head, hurting Edward's hand more than Stuckey's Vivian rushes out of room to bathroom.  Again Stuckey tri to rise.  Edward kicks him in the butt, sends him headfir the bar.  Glasses and bottles CRASH to the floor.  Stucke tries to rise.  And collapses.  Edward rubs his fist.  Th not used to this violence and both stare at each other pa

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: You broke my nose.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I think I broke my hand. (a beat) You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Edward, we've been together ten years.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: And I don't like what we've become.  I'll cover any losses you have on this one.  Now get out, you asshole!

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: All this because of that whore!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes. Edward pushes Stuckey out the door and throws his briefca after him.

dialogues.speaker: STUCKEY
dialogues.text: Edward, think about what you're
Edward slams the door in his face.  Edward stands there, reflecting on what he's done.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (to himself, almost proud) Well, I didn't plan that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward holds an icepack to Vivian's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Why do guys always know how to hit a woman?  Right across the cheek, wham, so it feels like your eye is gonna explode.  What do they do, take you all aside in high school and show you how? It pisses me off!

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Not all men hit.  And no one is going to hit you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Right. (softening) You're quite the Sir Galahad today, aren't ya'? (a beat) I heard what you did with Kross.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It was a business decision. Vivian looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I got tired of hating my father.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (a small smile) It was good.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: It felt good. Edward looks on the bed at her suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You're packing.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (nods) I'm leaving. (a moment) Don't ya see?  If I stay with you like you want me to, there'll always be some guy, your friends eve, treatin' me like that... thinkin' they're allowed to.  What are you gonna do, fight'm all? No.  I'll take my money now, please. A moment.  Edward reaches for his wallet.  He counts out He places them in Vivian's suitcase.  He puts his arms ar Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Aw, don't... no...

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Stay with me tonight.  Not because you're being paid to. Stay with me because you want to.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I do.  I do want to.  That's why I'm leaving. (turning to him) That's what you given me, see? I know what I want now.  I want a guy like you for real.  Not because you buy me things and give me money.  The nicest thing you ever done for me is hold my hand. You gonna give me that? Edward is silent.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I didn't think so.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Vivian...

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.  You're right.  Kit's right. (looks him right in the eye) But I want the fairy tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out of the elevators.  A BELLMAN sees her an springs forward, reaching for her bags.

dialogues.speaker: BELLMAN
dialogues.text: Let me take those, miss.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. Vivian sees Mr. Thomas behind the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'll be out front in a minute. I got a cab comin'. The bellman moves away.  Vivian walks to the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Hi, Barney!

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: (looking up) Miss Vivian.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Look I just wanted to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris doesn't check out until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I check out today.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're not accompanying him to New York?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: (lightly) Come on, Barney, you and me live in the real world. (a beat) You don't know how to treat a girl like anything but a lady, Mr. Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: MR. THOMAS
dialogues.text: Certain ladies make that very easy... Vivian. (turning to the desk clerk) John, call a limousine for our guest, please.  Have it take her anywhere she wishes to go.  Bill the hotel. (turning back to Vivian) See you again sometime soon. Vivian smiles softly at him.  She turns and walks for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silver limo drives down Hollywood Blvd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIMO DRIVER pushes the button that rolls down the scr between back and front seats.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: You're sure this is the right street, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. 1312.  It's a big apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls to a stop in front of a rundown apartment building on a dirty Hollywood side street.  The Limo Driv a large Latino man, steps out of the car and walks around the passenger door.  As he does, he surveys the surroundi uncomfortably.  Ths is rough neighborhood.  He opens the Vivian steps out.

dialogues.speaker: LIMO DRIVER
dialogues.text: Maybe I should go with you.  This doesn't look like a good place for a lady to be alone. Several PEOPLE pass.  All of them stare at the car, at th driver, at Vivian in her lovely clothes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I'll be okay.  I'm home.  Thank you. The driver, confused, watches her hurry up the steps to t apartment building.  He drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian walks toward her apartment.  The Landlord is sitti at the front desk in a dirty undershirt.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: Hey, we announce guests here. You a relative of somebody? Vivian lowers her sunglasses. LANDLORD (cont'd) Viv -- is that you?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's me. She keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: You lookin' good, Viv'.  Nice threads.  I gotta find time to shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward stands at the penthouse window, looking out.  He i dressed now, ready for travel.  There is something about expression, his somber demeanor that suggests the way we him at the very top of the story.  A BELLMAN enters from bedroom, rolling a luggage loaded dolly along in front of

dialogues.speaker: BELLMAN
dialogues.text: Is that everything, sir?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (turning from the window) That's everything. The Bellman exits, closing the door behind him.  The phon rings.  Edward crosses to it, picks it up.  The Maid come looks around.

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: The lady, she go?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes.  She go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward with the Bellhop heads to the front door.  He's le

dialogues.speaker: BELLHOP
dialogues.text: Do you have a car taking you to the airport, sir?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian, looking fresh scrubbed without make-up, is wearin clean jeans, a nice looking shirt and a suit jacket.  Her bureau's are open.  She is packing.  Kit is watching.  Sh the photo of her and Kit dressed up hot in hooker clothes packs it.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: So whatta' you going to do in San Francisco?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Get a job and probably go back to school.  Figure out what I'm gonna be.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What kind of school?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: School, school.  Regular.  I used to get pretty good grades in school, you know.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: So did I.  I made it with the principal. (recites) Study hard And get a "B."  Lift your dress and an "A" you'll see. They both laugh but too hard.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Want a pair of boots?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Do I!?  Momma! Taking them, she sits on the bed and puts them on.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You sure you won't come with me?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: And leave all this?  Not in a million. They laugh together. KIT (cont'd) What time's your bus?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Couple a hours.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Well... I gotta split. Goodbye's make me crazy.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Cool your jets a second. (going to her purse) Here's some money.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: No.  You took care of rent, that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I want to.  For food, got it? Eat something before the wind blows you away.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pay you back next time I see ya, babe.  Just wait, I'm gonna do something real nice for you some day. They hug. KIT (cont'd) Shit, I'm gettin' all weepy now. Kit begins backing out of the room. KIT (cont'd) Take care of you, okay?  Take care of you.  Love ya... Kit turns and hurries out of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit enters the falafel stand on Hollywood Boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit enters, sits at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Coffee, Chan.  And maybe a grilled cheese on white, okay? A very young GIRL is sitting just down the counter from K Kit nods at her.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doin'.  You new, huh?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Got a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Sure. She passes the girl down the pack.  She strikes a match, her cigarette for her.  The girl inhales deep, lets it ou a sigh.  She looks towards the window.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Jeez, did the wacko in the suit. Kit turns to look. KIT'S P.O.V. - HOLLYWOOD BLVD. Outside, across the street, Edward has accosted two PROSTITUTES; one blonde, one a red haired black one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit rises.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Chan?  Keep the sandwich warm, I'll be back. She heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is still talking to the prostitutes.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a girl, Vivian, young, dark hair, big eyes...? They shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: She's mouthy.  Sort of difficult...?

dialogues.speaker: PROSTITUTE 1
dialogues.text: Ain't seen her, wouldn't know her.

dialogues.speaker: PROSTITUTE 2
dialogues.text: What's wrong with us, man?  Two for the price a one, what ya say?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Thank you.  No. They turn and walk away.  Edward stands there, not knowin what to do next.  He looks discouraged and lost.

dialogues.speaker: KIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Edward Harris, as I live and breathe! Edward quickly turns to find Kit staring at him.  Kit smi triumphantly. KIT (cont'd) Yeah.  Boy, you're just like she said. She turns and starts away.  She stops, turns back. KIT (cont'd) You comin' or not?  I don't got all day, I got a grilled cheese waitin'. Edward follows Kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian sits on her bed, lost in thought.  Her bags are pa ready to go.  With a sigh she rises.  She picks up the ba exits the room. Vivian stands in the dreary living room, looking at it, t it all in for the last time.  She suddenly looks more tha little bit frightened to be leaving.  She musters resolve goes to the door, opens it and exits, closing it behind h Silence.  Vivian suddenly comes back in.  She puts down h bags.  She crosses to the kitchen where she takes coffee can/piggy bank from the shelf.  She puts some more bills it, places it back where Kit will find it. She turns and starts again for the door. She stops.  She hears something.  MUSIC.  An aria from La Boheme.  Faint.  Seemingly coming from nowhere.  She dism it -- she's hearing things.  She opens the door.  Stops. music is louder and getting louder now -- it's not her imagination.  She hurries over to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian comes out onto the fire escape.  She stares in won A snow white limo comes up the street.  A necktie has bee to the antennae like a knight's token.  The MUSIC from La is BLARING from the car's stereo.  Edward is standing on car's seat, his head and body up through the open sunroof wind blows at his hair.  He is smiling. Everywhere on the street people are staring; the BUMS, th PUSHERS, the PASSERBY'S, the TOURISTS. Vivian doesn't know whether to laugh or cry. The car comes to a stop in front of the Vivian's building Vivian's landlord comes out the front door.  His eyes go in disbelief. Edward disembarks from the limo by coming up through the sunroof.  He leaps nimbly to the ground.  He crosses to t of the alleyway, looking up at Vivian on the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIAN
dialogues.text: You are really lost this time. Edward wordlessly holds up a hand for her. With a sudden cry of joy, Vivian comes down the fire esca She stops at the bottom stair.  Edward comes forward and her into his arms.  They kiss. He carries her to the limo as if she's weightless.  Her f never touch the ground. The car door closes behind them.  The limo drives away. The people of the street watch it go.
